All Classes and Interfaces

Classes
Class
Description
AddAppointmentController
AddAppointmentController is the controller responsible for the add appointment page.
AddCustomerController
AddCustomerController handles adding a new customer in the AddCustomer view.
Appointment
The Appointment class creates instances of the Appointment class in the appointment controllers
AppointmentMainController
The appointmentMainController handles the main appointment page, including all redirect button clicks and table view population.
Contact
The contact class creates instances of the Contact class to populate the contact drop boxes
Country
The country class creates instances of the country class
Customer
The Customer class constructs instances of the Customer class and provides getter methods to return information on customer objects
CustomerMainController
The customerMainController handles the main customer page, including all redirect button clicks and table view population.
DBConnection
The DBConnection class creates DB connections that can be called with a single line, greatly reducing code clutter through the program.
DBPreparedStatement
The prepared statement exists to create prepared statements to declutter code throughout the application
HelloApplication
The class HelloApplication is the main class of the application that holds the application gateway
LoginController
This is the landing page for the application, handles login and logging services.
MainMenuController
MainMenuController is the controller responsible for the main menu view
ModifyAppointmentController
modify appointment controller handles the modify appointment view for modifying appointments
ModifyCustomerController
modify customer controller handles the modify customer view for modifying customers
Month
The Month class creates instances of the Month class
ReportController
This class handles the report view controller and its three table views
User
The User class allows for global static values to be set so the logged in user name can be accessed everywhere.
UserLocalTime
The UserLocalTime class allows for global static values to be set so the user's local time zone value can be accessed
